result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando V Sims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: count 1 & count 3 in 14CF1498

Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: count 1 & count 3 in 14CF1498
Consecutive to: **AMENDED 10/18/2018: To reflect consecutive to Counts 1 & 3 in 14CF1498.**

miscConds.notes: Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users. May not go into any premises where there is drug activity. Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Once released enroll in the Father Hood Program at the YMCA and report to Racine Vocational Ministry. Comply with family court order.  Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. May not go into any bars. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
